intro: Phaca macrostachys, commonly known as the large-stemmed phaca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Phaca macrostachys is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
